reviews.text: We were only at the Palazzo Ravizza for one night and what a pity. I would love to return for a week. The view out of our window was STUNNING and we were perfectly located to walk everywhere. The room is plenty big, and nicely appointed. Could use a bit of touching up in places (the upholstery on the chairs in our room was quite worn), but overall a GREAT place. So pretty from the foyer right up through the rooms. Everything was very clean and neat. Free internet access on three computers, which was convenient to email the kids. Lovely breakfast, gorgeous patio, great location. We would love to come back.
reviews.title: fabulous

reviews.text: There is something alluring about the Palazzo Ravizza that one cannot quite put his/her finger on. Perhaps it is the old stone facade, the enormous wooden doors, or the lonely grand piano on the second floor. Whatever the attraction, it reeks of history and seeming importance. This feeling carries over to the overall stay, because while the accomodations were not the plushest, they felt more plush simply because of the sourroundings (including the noise from the street through the wood shutters). The cold tile floors bracketed 18 feet above by wood beam ceiling feels authentic and this is the feeling you want in a town like Siena and at a place like Palazzo Ravizza. On a more traditional note, the services including breakfast and internet access were perfectly subtle and provided with aplomb. For all of these reasons, the Palazzo Ravizza should definitely be experinced.
reviews.title: Curiously Interesting

reviews.text: We stayed in the suite at the Palazzo Ravizza with a double jacuzzi and three rooms. It was really beautiful and we did feel like we were staying in a castle. The garden is lovely and we used to take a bottle of wine out at night after the restaurant closed. It was great. The restaurant is also wonderful and a little change from the "typical" Italian foods although they were there too. Would not hesitate for a moment to return there. It was wonderful. It kind of spoiled us for our next room in Rome which was quite a bit smaller.
reviews.title: Our castle....loved it.

reviews.text: We spent one night at this hotel and thoroughly enjoyed our room and the location. The buffet breakfast was also well above average and our room was extremely spacious. (We had chosen a Superior Room. I believe standard would be just fine here.) The hotel is in a quiet location yet convenient walk to the center of town and the cute little shops along the way. The double glazed windows provide complete quiet from any traffic below. Don't miss the garden out back. It is lovely with a wonderful view of the Tuscan hills. Reception staff is very helpful and speak perfect English. One word of caution: On check-out, our bill was charged in US dollars, rather than Euros, and the exchange rate was not the best for that day. This was our only encounter with the practice while in Italy, and it is NOT a convenience, as they stated. This made the room cost $7.00 more than the stated price. (We checked the conversion rate later.) Ask ahead of time that your charges be prepared in Euros and you'll pay what they quoted in the first place. This amount is not a great fortune, but we don't like to be taken advantage of by such practices!
reviews.title: Lovely Hotel
Beyond our expectations
reviews.text: We stayed at the Palazzo Ravizza for only two nights, Sept 12 & 13/05. Our room #31 was perfect.- very large and had an inroom safe. There was an updated bathroom with both shower and bathtub, and basic toiletries.

reviews.title: Amazing little gem of a place!
reviews.text: We were very happy with the Palazzo Ravizza! The staff actually moved us on our second night to a larger loft room at no additional charge because they simply thought we'd have more room. The loft room was wonderful and you couldn't beat the price. The location is great and the free parking is wonderful, since we used Sienna as a base to explore all of Tuscanny and Umbria. The only small complaint might be the lack of water pressure when you book a loft room, but that's a small price to pay for the value.

reviews.title: Staying in Sienna
reviews.text: Loft room 50# is definately the one to go for. The views are fantastic, the room whilst simply furnished is comfortable and in the local style. Excellent service and breakfast. Centrally located with parking, beware traffic wardens do give tickets for illegally parked vehicles if you are loading/unloading at the hotel put a note in the window and don't leave it more than 15 mins. The hotel car park is excellent and easy to access.

reviews.title: Pear Risotto & Fantastic View
reviews.text: What a find!...thanks to trip advisor reviews we chose this hotel for a 3 night stay in Siena...a little bit of green in amongst the stereo type of buildings and pavement! The garden is a treat and a room facing this garden is an absolute must. The pear and pecorino risotto was to die for and a table in the garden setting a memory we will not forget...spacious rooms, giant bath and helpful staff, what more could you wish for.

reviews.title: Delightful B&B with Suberb Restaurant & Views
reviews.text: Throw back your shutters on arrival and ENJOY!

reviews.title: an historical gem
reviews.text: Was in Italy in Sept 2005 and this was my favorite city and favorite hotel. Right out of the fairy tale book, just like the city of Siena. Excellent location, very friendly and helpful staff, fabulous garden views from the junior suite, and a wonderful garden and restaurant on site. The pear risotto was unbeatable and wine selection very wide. Free internet. Being in an older building, the space was a bit unusual. Very large bedroom with balcony (chairs and table) overlooking garden and hills of Tuscany. Long and very narrow bath--but a jacuzzi tub and wonderful ammenities. 220 E. I would go back and stay a week!!!

That view from our bedroom window at Palazzo Ravizza was our “Tuscany” moment. My partner & I stayed in Siena for 2 nights while visiting Rome and Florence – and Siena took our breath away most of all. We spent the 2 days in Siena strolling, enjoying the street life and shopping. The Duomo in Siena was our favorite church – the architecture is quite dizzying and over the top. The view from the incomplete basilica is more than worth the climb up (see picture attached). And be sure to catch the Contemporary Art Museum – it was a pleasant surprise.
reviews.title: The unbelievable View!

reviews.text: Palazzo Ravizza matched the beauty of the city. We had an unbelievable view of the Tuscany Hills – our room faced the gardens. We spent so much time sitting in the window looking out over picturesque scenery. The room was also huge, with a large bathroom. The breakfast had everything that one would need – eggs, bacon, ham, croissants, coffee, cereal, fruit, etc, etc.
reviews.title: Extraordinary Experience!
Great stay at Palazzo Ravizza
reviews.text: We also thought based on prior reviews that this hotel was outside the city walls – but it’s not. The hotel is right within the city walls – the location could not have been more perfect as it was peaceful and allowed us to have this amazing view. Also, catch the amazing bakery right around the corner of the hotel that was a window into their kitchen – the baked goods and the chocolate are deliciously out-of-this-world.

reviews.title: Noisy room
reviews.text: Also as a gay couple, the hotel was very accommodating and comfortable.

reviews.title: Best value within the city walls
reviews.text: We stayed for three nights in mid-October 2005 and wish it could have been at least a week. This should be a destination in and of itself. Ask for a room at the back to get the stunning views from a hill-top perspective over the Tuscan countryside. There is also a beautiful huge garden with the same views plus staff nearby to bring you wine or food to enhance your enjoyment. Everything about this hotel is marvelous. The concierges are extremely friendly and helpful and in fact all the personnel are cheerful and outgoing. Trust their restaurant recommendations. There is free internet access on three computers and free parking. Breakfast was ample: eggs, bacon, sausage, cereal, croissants, fresh rolls, juice, coffee, English marmalade. The Duomo and Campo are 10 minutes away but the hotel feels quiet and secluded. Our room was spacious with a modernized, ultra-clean bathroom. Highest recommendation. - V&J

We had a recent (Sept 05) trip through Italy - with 2 nights at this Pensione. Without doubt this is the nicest Hotel we stayed in. We have stayed in more 'upmarket' places in the past - but for sheer ambience this place is the best.
reviews.title: Without doubt - our favorite Hotel. 5 out of 5 !
Wow!
reviews.text: What a stunning view - if you are going to stay there - you MUST and I mean must take a room with the garden view. The view out the window to the rolling hills of Tuscany has to be seen to be believed.

reviews.title: 10+ on a 1-10 scale
reviews.text: The room were clean, airconditioning was fine (we hardly needed it - Sept) and the bathrooms were excellent. The Hotel is about a 5-10min walk from the Cathedral and Piazza and is in a lovely part of town. Staff all spoke english very well and were very helpful and informative,
Absolutely nothing to complain about with this place. Really very good value. It deserves the 5 stars (out of 5) that we and all the other reviewers have given it.
reviews.title: Beautiful, stately and charming!
Great Siena Spot
reviews.text: I have travelled a lot and stayed in many wonderful hotels. The room we had at this hotel was the greatest room I have ever seen. We were in the "garden suite" and the room was not only big, but antique and wonderfully decorated. The room opened onto a magnificent garden and terrace. The hotel was unbelievable value for money, perfect position in Siena, and the people and food were great.
